answers.text:
Hi Jeffrey,
Thank you for your question.  I’ve done some research on municipal waste removal and found a few resources on the Knowledge Network that might be useful to you. 
Reshaping Public Attitudes and Municipal Government Approaches to Solid Waste Management in Blagoevgrad
icma.org/Documents/Document/Document/107173‎
Read here about ‘Improved Solid Waste Management in Jabalpur.’  This municipality in India work with the Sacramento County Government in California to improve their community.  
icma.org/Documents/Document/Document/50736‎
I also found this article on Combustion and the removal of Municipal Solid Waste. 
http://www.epa.gov/osw/nonhaz/municipal/combustion.htm
Check out our blog on the Knowledge Network, Sustainable Communities.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/blogs/blog/32/Sustainable_Communities
I hope some of these links helped you find your answer!
Hilary Badger
Knowledge Network, Intern
ICMA

author: Jeffrey French
text:
Barron County is one of two municipalities in Wisconsin that burns municipal solid waste, beginning in 1986.  The plant is now 27 years old and we are giving consideration, possibly, of a major rebuild.  
My question is this: does anyone have information on what it would possibly cost should we choose not to rebuild but rather to decommission?  
please respond to: jeff.french@co.barron.wi.us
Thank you.
title: Incinerating Municipal Solid Waste
